com.rapidminer.extension.indatabase.provider

Interface DatabaseProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmbeddedProvider, GenericProvider, GoogleBigQueryProvider, MySQLProvider, PostgreSQLProvider

    public interface DatabaseProvider
    Responsible for interacting with the database (metadata discovery) and assembling the SQL code in database-specific way. Many default implementations are provided - whenever a method does not work, the database-specific provider class should override it.

        default java.lang.String escapeLikeExpr(java.lang.String str)

      • supportsInfinity

        default boolean supportsInfinity()
        Specifies if the database can handle Infinity values in filter expressions. If this function returns true (default), the provider must implement escapeInfinity(String).
        Returns:

      • escapeInfinity

        default java.lang.String escapeInfinity(java.lang.String val)
        If supportsInfinity() returns true, the provider must be able to format infinity values. This function accepts a value in RapidMiner format and if there is an Infinity value in it, it must change it to a format that the database recognizes.
        Parameters:
        val -
        Returns:

      • format

        default java.lang.String format(java.lang.String val,
                                Column c)
        This function re-formats the date format in filter expressions to comply with the format used by the database.
        Parameters:
        val -
        c -
        Returns:

      • getFirstNonNullExpr

        default java.lang.String getFirstNonNullExpr()
        This function should return the database-specific COALESCE function - the function that takes the first non-null value. Returned String should refer to the two String inputs using '%s'.
        Returns:

      • getFilterSyntax

        default java.util.Map<Filter.FilterCondition,java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getFilterSyntax()
        Each Filter.FilterCondition must be translated to a DB-specific expression. The map returned by this function contains a (String,String)-to-String function for each condition. Each of those functions converts the column and condition value into an expression implementing the filter. Helper methods like escapeInfinity(String), escapeLikeExpr(String) must be properly implemented.
        Returns:

      • supportsDropIfExistsSyntax

        default boolean supportsDropIfExistsSyntax()
        Specifies if the database supports DROP TABLE IF EXISTS clause. If not, simple DROP TABLE statement is used to overwrite a table - the error is caught, but logged in this case to avoid getting an error on first run.
        Returns:
        Since:
        9.5

      • dropIfExists

        default void dropIfExists(Nest nest,
                          QueryRunner queryRunner,
                          Table table)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.InterruptedException,
                          com.rapidminer.operator.OperatorException
        Drops database table (if exists).
        Parameters:
        nest - the Nest, which needs the database table deletion. (Required for the DatabaseProvider and CachedDatabaseHandler objects). Must not be null.
        queryRunner - QueryRunner object for execute DB query. Must not be null.
        table - target table to drop. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if error occurs during DB operations.
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        com.rapidminer.operator.OperatorException - if nest is not initialized, or error occurs during querying metadata.
        Since:
        9.5

      • createQueryRunner

        default QueryRunner createQueryRunner(CachedDatabaseHandler handler)
                               throws com.rapidminer.operator.UserError,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
        Returns a QueryRunner to execute queries. Default implementation returns a JdbcQueryRunner, subclasses can override this when not using a JDBC driver.
        Parameters:
        handler -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        com.rapidminer.operator.UserError
        java.sql.SQLException
        Since:
        9.5
